direction.raw_text: Inspired by a true story. We home in on a boat coming in to shore. Off walks a man, he is carrying a backpack and wearing shades. EXT. TOWN He walks through a town, passing various stores and the general bustle of the people there. He notices a baby in a pram left out on the sidewalk, then sees the mother is in an alleyway doing what looks like a drug deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris reads a closure notice on the door. A police car rolls up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris turns around and the sheriff notices his name on a bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sheriff chuckles and steps out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They shake hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris raises his hands and the sheriff chuckles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How ya doin'?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ok. When'd the mill close?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ahh 3 years this August. If ya lookin for work you might wanna try Aberdeen, that's the closest mill work you're gonna find around here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's too bad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nah just simple economics. Y'know we have a really nice casino here, the wild cherry. You wanna make some money maybe you wanna go on down there and try your luck at the blackjack tables.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nah I don't think so. Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're Chris Vaughn?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well hell, I know all about you Chris. I know your folks, I'm sheriff Stan Watkins.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How ya doin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ralston get outta the car, you're lookin at a real soldier here pay some respect.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Welcome home soldier.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here Chris, (opens the back door) We'll give ya a ride up to your folks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nah I'm fine thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I insist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll walk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey it's my pleasure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's ok.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't take no for an answer (jokingly reaches for his gun). HEY! Get in the car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did I scare ya with that one?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lil bit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ya. Let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: You were gone a while huh?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: 8 years. Harstad was sheriff back then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Harstad, yeah. Sad story. About 5 months back he fell asleep at the wheel and uhhh... hit a tree. Good man, good man and a good sheriff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Thanks for the ride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris takes the paper and smiles. He walks up the lane toward the house, a simple white building clad in wood. A lady dressed in a police uniform comes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They laugh together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris hugs his mother, Connie. A man slowly emerges from the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hug again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No problem, and uh Chris (hands him a piece of paper). It's election month... I'm your man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I help you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lil' brother.. You come over here and gimme a hug.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You look great.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, I couldn't let you be the only one looking good in uniform. Hey ma! Chris is here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's with the tent? (points to a tent set up on the lawn).
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, that's for Pete.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look at you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How ya doin!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How long do we have ya for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For good. I'm home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really? You're not kiddin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey dad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Welcome back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The family are eating takeaway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A kid walks in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I wish you would have told me you were coming I would've cooked.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is great.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So what are you gonna do now that you're home?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well I was planning on working at the mill, your letters never mentioned that it was closed. CONNIE We didn't wanna bother you with our problems when your father got laid off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got my business, you saw the furniture outside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I substitute at the elementary school, Michelle pitches in. We try to keep things simple.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pete! This is your Uncle Chris.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey Pete.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sit down, say hello. Last time he saw you you were barely walking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And now I'm camping.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said you could sleep on the couch. It was Chris' room first.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your tent's gonna take on water. I could show ya how to rig it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Doesn't look like it's gonna rain to me Colonel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pete, cmon sit down, have somethin to eat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: First of all I was a sergeant. I worked for a living.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you ever smoke anybody?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pete!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pete!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Y'know, Papa's still got your gun locked up in the garage. Think you could teach me how to shoot?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I figured that'd be scrap metal by now dad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I'm still hoping that you'll melt that thing down on your own.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry Pete.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever. I'm outta here Mom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, be back by ten.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ten thirty (as he walks out)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ten!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Remind you of anyone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We can see from the window that it's raining heavily outside. Chris sets about unpacking his things. Pete comes in looking wet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pete looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris looks at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ok it rained. Happy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Why dontcha crash on the floor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ok, I'll crash on the floor, you crash on the bed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: uh uh. (starts walking out)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pete. (hands him a towel). Keep ya dry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you really kill people?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A crappy camper van rolls up. A man steps out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray shrugs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ray Ray! Ahaaa.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello puddin'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How ya doin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm alright.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is that? (points to the van)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the lovemachine. CHRIS Girls actually get in there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How ya been?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good. Clean livin. CHRIS Wanna beer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Believe it or not I quit drinkin. I'll take a soda though. CHRIS Here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whoah. (spots a tattoo of a guitar on Ray's arm).
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ya like that? When you left town it gave me the idea that I should do something with my life too so uhh I went down to Seattle, got a guitar and became all about music. And then pretty soon I was about music and drugs, n pretty soon I was basically just about drugs. Ended up doin 2 years for B+E.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nahh, look at me now though right? I been clean and sober for 14 months, doing construction and renewing those supportive and healthy friendships from my past. Matter of fact I talked to the bastards, told em you were back and they asked me to politely remind you that kick off's in twenty minutes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A group of guys are there waiting, one of them holding a ball. They salute as Chris walks up. They all laugh. CHRIS Playin ball?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a voice shouts 'HEADS UP' Chris catches a fast ball thrown from behind. Jay steps out of his vehicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another truck with a few guys on it pulls up
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A football game ensues, there are two teams. Jay's guys vs Chris' guys. On the sidelines Pete pulls up on a small motorcycle. Chris notices Pete hanging around with kids smoking. It comes down to the last play, the teams are huddled into two groups talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris gets the ball and throws it. An opponent comes in hard and tackles him low. He collapses. Ray runs for the ball but gets clotheslined by Jay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris Helps Ray onto his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jay speeds off in his car. Pete rolls up on his bike.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Let's play ball!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ray go deep go deep! (as Ray runs off he throws the ball into Ray's back).
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Spotting a sign that reads 'HAMILTON FIELD') When did that happen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: His parents hadn't left him the mill more than 2 minutes before he shut it down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cause I opened my Casino.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Still got a gut huh Jay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Still got your reflexes. What, you get tired of being all that you can be?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm still all I can be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really? I'll just have to see about that. What brings you home?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just wanna relax, catch my breath.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You? Relax?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If we score here we win right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright boys, last play. We need to put this to rest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just give me the ball.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got it. On the first hut!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ok Vaughn, last chance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's game!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Chris) Sorry about that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's cool man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Welcome home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good to be back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See ya round. Hey, if you're not doing anythin later on you could come by the casino. I'll introduce ya to some nice girls, drinks are on me. Whaddya say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See ya tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cool.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey Sarge, good game. Maybe next time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hold up. Maybe next time I won't see you with the bleachers smoking weed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Welcome home buddy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Don't you have to be native american to own a casino?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all laugh.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: OUTSIDE THE WILD CHERRY CASINO CHRIS

dialogue.raw_text: Oh Hamilton's one sixteenth black man now. FRIEND 2 Just so you guys know, I'm gonna triple my money tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yea, like last time. Wound up selling your body for bus fare. FRIEND 4 He had to walk!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nobody's gonna have any problems finding this place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's the subtle attention to aesthetics that I find most impressive, blends in with the mountains SO nicely.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The place is packed with gambling tables and attractive women. FRIEND Not bad huh?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Not bad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't it wonderful? All your gambling needs under one great big roof. You got your ATM machine, tellers to cash your paycheck, and when you're here you don't gotta worry about those lil things like child support, rent, the laws of mathematical probability.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gentlemen, Mr Hamilton would like to invite you to the VIP lounge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, 'Mister' Hamilton.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Heyyy, the dream team!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all down some drinks. They lead Chris down a corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris' friends have led him to a stripping booth, his friend inserts the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His friends leave, closing the door behind them. A screen goes up and a striptease begins. The lady is dressed in the style of a firewoman and has a pole in the center of the stage. She dances around the pole and removes clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lights come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The screen goes down again, Chris leaves the booth.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Nice place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah well. Welcome to my world. Look tonight, all the drinks are on the house. If you need a line of credit, say how much. And if you need a lil female companionship... done. Alright? Have a good time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where you goin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you worry about me, I've got a few things to do. Enjoy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just remember, nothin in here's free. C'mon, this place is nothin but fake boobs and real assholes if ya ask me. Just water for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here's to you Chris.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't say we never did nothin' for ya!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry, everybody's a lil scared the first time. Get in there, sit back and enjoy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you're not back by morning we'll send a search party for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bye! No drinking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So you from here or just visiting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lil of both, I grew up here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So you've seen all the old faces.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could say that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your voice sounds very familiar.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chris...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Deni..
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Look who's back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So, good surprise?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Told you it was better than gambling. You met Candy? (A girl is dancing on their table)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey Candy. (to the guys) Let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! Easy 6 for a win! JIMMY (To some girls) We can do a 6.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris notices something odd, he looks concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dice have landed and it's a 7. Jimmy hangs his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris puts a load of money on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris has taken the dice. CHRIS Put your bets down on the pass line. These dice are comin up seven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris rolls the dice and sure enough it's a seven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The security guy grabs Chris around the neck. Chris elbows him and throws him onto the table. The croupier takes a fighting stance. Jimmy taps Chris on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More security men appear, one of them knocks Jimmy out. A whole fight breaks out, Ray gets knocked out. Chris beats off several security men before taking an electric shock to the neck and a baton to the face. Chris wakes up on a table under a light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris grabs him by the neck but they beat him down again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He rips open Chris' shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A struggle ensues and Chris' chest is cut up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (To Chris) We're gettin killed out here. I need you to put 200 down for the bet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, hell no.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look at them (Nods to girls).
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ok.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Five hundred on 6?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, I'm in. Boom! Gimme some dice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lookin' for a 6.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jimmy. Don't roll. Gimme the dice. CROUPIER Lookin' for a 6. Ohhhhh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To the croupier) You're good, but I saw it. CROUPIER Saw what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw the switch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey this is a clean game asshole.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yea?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's see about that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bet you I'll roll a seven.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not your roll sir. SIR! It's not your roll. Call security.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chris, why don't we just let it go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, we gonna let it ride Jimmy. The dice are comin up seven.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not your roll sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No folks, no payout. CHRIS (To croupier) Why don't you just take care of that bet and we're even.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well I would but it wasn't a legitimate bet, you're not the shooter. It's not your (Chris shoves him) ROLL sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is there a problem?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yea, the problem is your dice are loaded. Does your boss know about this? Just gimme my money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, let's go! let's go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Sees the tag around Chris' neck) Special forces? I'll take that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Has a scalpel in his hand) Special forces... special treatment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This guy knows Hamilton!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We see Chris is crawling, badly hurt. A truck stops directly in front of him. Chris passes out again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (To Chris' family) Folks, he's pretty banged up, inside and out. Whoever did this left him for dead. A lesser man wouldn't have survived.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doctor nods.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm gonna need a statement from him Doctor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's in no condition to give you one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll also need a copy of your write-up along with toxicoloy, blood alcohol level and so on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you talkin about Stan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm just tryin to get some facts here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh come on you need to be out arresting whoever tried to kill my brother not testing his BLOOD. SHERIFF WATKINS I'm just doing my job Michelle. Ok? I understand how you feel. But we still don't know yet who started all of this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well it wasn't Chris.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just find out who did this to him Stan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll do my best Mr Vaughn. I really will. In the meantime I have to file a full report. You lemme know when I can talk to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's gonna be fine Michelle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ray goes into a room and takes a big bunch of flowers from there. NURSE BEAUTIFUL flowers!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, they're for my best friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hey sarge, so much for our VIP... status. Don't they teach you any fighting skills in the army.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris begins to laugh but is in pain.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How did you do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not good. But I tell you, that guy was feelin me this morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Some homecoming hey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know if you've noticed but this aint exactly home any more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Chris has returned home. He's still in bad shape and his parents help him out of the car. He insists on taking the steps by himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris laughs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There's some old crutches in the garage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A montage ensues with Chris on the couch, sometimes with Ray, other times with Pete. Chris is recovering, and is exercising by the end of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris pulls the cover off an old truck. He smiles and gets in. He starts the engine.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Changed the plugs a while back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Appreciate that Dad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I might've had serious issues with your career choice but just didn't seem fair to take it out on an innocent truck. Where you headin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was goin into town to get some supplies. Wanna come?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ya whole life, all you wanted to do was get outta here. What made you come back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They laugh.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You gonna think I'm crazy. I been thinking about the mill. When I was a kid goin to visit you at work, the smell of that fresh-cut cedar. You remember that smell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mmm I remember a lotta nice things before the mill closed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When did they go outta business? (Nods to a closed supply store).
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Closed about six months ago. There's a home depot about fifteen minutes up the road.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And that? (Nods to an adult XXX shop)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't ask.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jay pulls up in his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jay starts to help Chris taking wood off the truck but Chris throws it back on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts down an envelope with money in it. Chris gives it back to him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey. First of all I wanna say thanks. CHRIS For what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's been fired, and his gaming permit's been pulled. I don't know how my security cameras didn't catch that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They miss a lot at your place don't they Jay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look Chris I hate seein ya like this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your boys did it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait wait... so they got a little rough, they were a bit edgy. Understandably. You don't know what kind of assholes they have to put up with on a daily basis. Look, they've been reprimanded. They say you went nuts man. I'm sorry. I know the proper term vets use is post traumatic stress.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the fuck are you talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever it was, you tore my place apart and it wasn't easy for me to get my guys agree not to press charges. Look Chris, if you had a problem... shouldn't you have come to me? Look, I wanna bring you inside. Chris I wanna make you head of security. Whaddya say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah well. I guess you probably need time to think about it. This is for you. It's a little something to help you get... Y'know..
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on man, don't be like that. I came all the way out here to your house just to see you get back on your feet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm goin to the sheriff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry you feel that way. I'll see ya round Chris.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. An officer is on the phone ignoring him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sheriff comes out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well hey Chris. Good to see you up and about, you're lookin spiffy. CHRIS I'm here to press charges. SHERIFF WATKINS Well this isn't about that incident at the casino a while back is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yea, it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cause that matter's closed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you look into it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They did an internal investigation. That's good enough for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An internal investigation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chris, I know you're familiar with the term 'no fly zone'. Hmm? Cause that's what the casino is. Since the mill closed down that casino is the main source of revenue in this town. So, case closed basically. I'll see ya.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not gonna let this stand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me? What did you say to me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said I'm not gonna let this stand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're lucky to be alive right now, that's all you need to be concentrating on. This is my town ok, I'm the sheriff here. I'll tell you what will stand, not the other way around. Now please get out of my building.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Deni is at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hands him a leather jacket.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This belongs to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I appreciate that, I thought this was history.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Coulda left it in the trash but I...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Deni? Nice to see you dear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi Mrs Vaughn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I talk to you outside for a second. Mom I'll be right back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: How you been?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She begins to drive off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She toots the horn as she goes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Been better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Talked to the sheriff yet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well I went down to the police station and I talked to somebody with a badge. Sure as hell didn't seem like much of a sheriff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's up for re-election you know. Maybe you could take his job. CHRIS Somebody ought to. How about you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sunshine and pine trees. Been readin these books, teach you how to cultivate happiness. Books on the future, go with the flow, that sorta thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is it workin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have my moments.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So the casino huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yep. Been there almost a year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Treatin you good?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lot better than it treated you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I like that. Jay Hamilton's done well for himself hasn't he.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yea, he's a real go-getter that one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Must be. I heard he got you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lasted about 8 minutes, a long long time ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You still work for him though.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rent's gotta be paid Chris.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Suppose so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hope to see you around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks for the jacket.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Connie is on the phone. CONNIE And where is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Vaughn's truck pulls up at speed. They enter a garage, Pete is on a stretcher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris approaches the kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris gets into his truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris speeds off. He pulls up at their home and enters the garage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris is searching about and forces open a cupboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris pulls out a shotgun and loads it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris drives to the casino, he cocks the shotgun but decides to leave it in the truck. Instead he takes a piece of wood from the back of his truck. He enters the casino with it. He smashes a fruit machine. A guard comes up and Chris beats him. A fight scene breaks out with Chris beating the guards and generally trashing the place. He takes back his special forces dogtag from the guard who stole it. Chris hurls his piece of wood at the VIP lounge window, smashing it to pieces. Jay emerges from behind it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris leaves. As he drives off in his truck, police cars appear with sirens going. He pulls over.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's ok mom he's stabilised. (To Chris) It was close. Crystal Meth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry. I never did it before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's true. We mighta kinda pushed him into it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where'd you get the drugs?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not really sure...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop. Where?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: From the security guys workin at the casino.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chris, wait. Call the police.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, that won't do any good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is Pete ok?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He'll be fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw Chris not like this. Chris listen to me. If you go outta here with that gun, they're gonna.. ne... Chris!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guess that changes our relationship a bit huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should NOT have come looking for trouble. Keep your hands up, get out of the vehicle now Chris! NOW!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I advise you to give this offer more than a little serious thought. If you go to trial you stand to do 18 years. This is a sweet plea, normally they wouldn't even put it on the table but your military record can't be ignored. Three months home arrest, some community service. Pretty generous offer Chris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see a montage of casino workers badmouthing Chris.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: But I'd have to plead guilty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look at it from the other side. There's over a dozen witnesses, none of em are gonna paint a very flattering picture.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He started bustin up the machines...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There was a gunshot..
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Went crazy...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Complete psychopath.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're only offering me this deal just to keep me quiet. LAWYER Well I still say you should take it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wasn't wrong. And I won't say I was.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Our job is to keep order. But there was no chance of that. Me and my men we were just tryin to control him. He was highly trained, violent, very dangerous person. PROSECUTOR So dangerous, so violent, so highly trained that he despatched six of the casino staff single handedly. His weapon of choice a simple piece of cedar. Which in his hand became a devastating force with one aim, to hurt people, destroy property.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd breaks into cheer. Chris takes a tag from his piece of cedar wood which is laying on the evidence table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowds fade away with chants of 'Sheriff Vaughn'.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He went directly for everything. He just came in and took over the place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You said he broke your arm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yea that's correct, my right forearm. Both bones with a single shot. It was crazy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, toss out a coupla drunks now and then. Guys try to grope the girls, but ah nothing with this sort of violence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did he give you any kind of advanced warning? A chance to defend yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We tussled, but he's a big guy. He was on a mission. Besides, he seemed to be too busy enjoying himself from what I could see. PROSECUTOR So from what you saw, it seemed like he had some kinda purpose?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think he had a point to prove yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was emptyin machines when Mr Vaugh came in and started swingin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was tryin to get outta there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr Crow, you may present your client's case.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To his lawyer) You're fired.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your honor, I'd like to plead my own case. JUDGE Order, order. Mr Vaughn, if you choose to represent yourself and not be represented by legal counsel you realise that you can't then claim a mistrial on that basis.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes I do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very well Mr Vaughn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't deny anything that was said here today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does that mean you're changing your plea to guilty?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not guilty of anything. Except standing up for myself when the law wouldn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Objection. He's trying to introduce prior events your honor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sustained. Mr Vaughn stay on point.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I grew up in this town. People used to walk tall in this town, they wouldn't have traded the mill for a crooked casino.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr Vaughn we're not here to listen to civic speeches.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And they wouldn't have stood around while drugs were being sold to kids. OPPOSITION Objection.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sustained. Mr Vaughn you're close to being held in contempt. CHRIS I was justified in what I did, and if you acquit me of these charges I'm gonna run for sheriff. And if elected, I'm gonna fix this town. JUDGE Order, order. Mr Vaughn you are now charged with contempt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I will make sure that THIS (He opens his shirt revealing huge scarring) never happens to anyone again without punishing those who did it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I order the jury to ignore what they have just seen. Mr Vaughn take your seat. Order! Order!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr Forman, has the jury reached a verdict?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We have your honor. JUDGE Will the defendant please rise. FORMAN We find the defendant Chris Vaughn not guilty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Chris pulls up to the station in his police truck, it's clear he's now the sheriff.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sheriff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Watkins.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well you won the election, congratulations. We do have a tradition of professional courtesy up here, and I can personally vouch for each and every one of these men. They're good deputies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're all fired.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Chris takes a look around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jay is speeding along in a sportscar. He is pulled over by a police truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jay hands it over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris hands it over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris smashes up the back end of Jay's car with his trusty piece of cedar wood.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey Chris.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: License and registration please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're joking right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: License and registration.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the problem sheriff?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You. And the drugs you're pedalling out of your casino.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh. Only thing that's going on in my casino right now is reconstruction. You took care of that. CHRIS Yea that's right and I plan on taking care of everything else too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you can, try to think this through. A casino is a license to print money. Why would I jeopardise that by selling drugs?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cause you owned the town Jay. It's changed now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really? See the only thing that I think has changed around here is that every morning you get to wake up and put on that nifty lil badge. But underneath that badge is the same guy that couldn't make it playing college football, apparently couldn't make it in the army and not gonna make it as a cop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yea, and if you push too hard you're gonna be a man who doesn't live to see 40. License please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks sheriff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir get your tail lights fixed, it's your last warning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's wrong with my tail lights?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're broken.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mornin sheriff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris tosses Ray a badge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A montage ensues, with Chris and Ray busting various drug dealers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mornin deputy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, nope, no. Come on man you know I hate cops. You been sheriff 2 minutes and I'm already startin to hate you. I'm a convicted felon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got a lil pull around here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh now you're a CROOKED cop doing favours for friends. That's how it starts. See next thing you know you'll be taking bribes, setting up roadblocks, frisking dudes crotches. CHRIS Are you done? Ray I need your help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh don't do that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need you to take me to drugs school.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I get to wear a uniform?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: You're SURE you're not carrying anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Music plays while the two chop up the dealer's car into pieces while laughing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't have shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Officer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Search him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh. Spread your legs, arms down. Been workin out? Nothin there. Ohhhh somebody needs a BATH!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now you read me my rights and take me in. And I call my lawyer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . I have a hunch there may be somethin else in here (Pats the dealer's truck).
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's clean. Guess we gotta move to plan B.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Screw you, I do have a bit of information for you. It's not just me actually, there's a whole lotta people in on this one. CHRIS Spit it out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're gonna get hurt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Chris is in the room with a shotgun.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why does it always have to be your fight?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You might need this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I put my guns down a long time ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're just being stubborn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You and me both boy. Chris, listen. You be careful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Booth is locked up, Ray is taunting him through a loudspeaker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris has walked in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris hands him the shotgun.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Please step away from the vehicle. Now Mr Booth are you still upset over that body cavity search? WOOOOOOOO! I forgot, you got no vehicle. Please disperse, there is nothing to s...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I talk to you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Over here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm gonna stay with him tonight. I need you to take care of my parent's place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You think they're gonna take it that far?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm with you man, I'll check in later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Deni comes into the police station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris grabs her and they kiss. INT. FAMILY HOUSE Ray is on the couch and has just woken to a noise.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't shoot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi. How's the food around here? Brought you special treats. Salmon, Fried Chicken, Potato Salad. You got cups?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you have to work tonight?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hmm I quit. I figured you know, you were making some changes around here, I could make a few myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's Pete. Want something to eat?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No I'm good man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I gotta get a bigger bed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No, no you don't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jay calls a number on his celphone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: m hungry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A loud explosion happens, it's Chris' police truck outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris steps towards the front of the building but men outside open fire, Chris ducks for cover. CHRIS (To Deni) Get down!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Got leftovers...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mm mmm, I want pancakes, and eggs, and bacon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! I told you Vaughn! Uh ohhhh. Who needs to step away from the vehicle now Vaughn? Truck for truck baby, that's right, truck for a truck.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Pete, somethin's burnin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Men with machine guns are still firing at the police station. Deni's screaming, Booth is cheering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris gives Deni a pistol.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Take that and get in there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Pete? Ray steps into the kitchen but gunmen have infiltrated the home. A fight breaks out and Pete flees. Ray jumps onto the back of a gunman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris shoots up the floor with a shotgun and breaks a hole in it. INT. FAMILY HOUSE Ray stabs the gunman with a potato peeler and knocks him out with a frying pan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (To Deni) Come here. They get down into the hole in the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Booth is now under fire and is scared.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: When I say 'now' start shooting, over there. Stay low.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Vaughn you gotta get me outta here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Two other gunmen in stocking masks are holding the family hostage upstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gunman takes off his mask and hits him with a pistol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He goes downstairs to find Burke dead on the kitchen floor. He follows traces of blood across the floor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I know who you are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh yeah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Calling downstairs) Burke?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Check it out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Chris is making his way towards Booth under fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gunshots hit near booth.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: C'mon! Get me outta here man!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's it worth to you? Where's the lab?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Screw you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ok! Ok! Hamilton's operation is at the mill ok! It's at the mill now get me outta here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The gunman enters a room, Ray is there pointing a shotgun at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Drop it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Stay down! Booth is standing and gets shot dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray shoots the gunman, who falls to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stay down!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Booth is dead so Chris leaves him there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (To gunman's body on the floor) Hey.. you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gunman 2 looks away for a second and Michelle kicks him down the stairs. As he tumbles down Ray reloads his shotgun. The two begin firing at each other, taking cover behind the furniture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tried to warn ya Chris. Didn't want this to happen. One of the men outside has a canister. Watkins gives him the nod and he begins walking towards the station. Chris is beneath the floor and shoots him in the legs. The two remaining men outside open fire again. Another gunman tries to approach but he's shot in the legs as well. Watkins enters the station and fires repeatedly at the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deni fires off some shots. Watkins is distracted by the shots, Chris appears in the floor hole and blasts Watkins at close range with a shotgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris climbs out of the hole and they hug.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Come get some! WOOOOOOOOO!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Deni! Now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Deni.... Deni.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shots are still being fired in the lounge. Ray and the gunman begin to wrestle. Ray wins and punches the man repeatedly. Chris has come back to the house and tries to pull Ray off the man, Ray mistakenly hits Chris in the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris helps Ray over to a chair, Ray has taken a shot to the leg. The injured gunman from the kitchen appears brandishing a pistol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris and Ray hold up their hands. He aims at Ray but he's shot in the back of the head by Dad who is approaching down the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad nods.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You stabbed me... with a potato peeler??
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You gonna be ok?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Chris is in a police car driving at speed. He approaches the mill and busts through the locked gates. INT. THE MILL The mill is dark, Chris is finding his way around using a torch. He finds Jay sitting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jay hits a metal saw which resonates making a metallic sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jay stands up and holds up his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jay hits a switch on the floor which opens a hatch. Chris falls into the hatch but hangs onto the saw which is swinging over it. Jay hits more switches, powering up the machinery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jay hits Chris in the stomach with a pole a few times. Chris grabs the pole and they both fall. Chris has hurt his leg. Chris stumbles off into the woods. Jay grabs an axe and goes after him, he swings the axe but misses and they both fall down a large earthy embankment. At the bottom they come to their senses and begin fighting again, Jay with his axe and Chris with a log he's ripped off a tree. Chris knocks Jay out by hitting him hard in the legs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey Chris.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get up Jay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just a sec. Remember we used to play hide n seek up here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That was my favourite sound. CHRIS Get up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look... Chris... just...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You wanna know what my new favourite sound's gonna be? The sound of you screaming like a little bitch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're right Jay, this does change our relationship. This is my town, you're under arrest.
dialogue.name: dialogue
